result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawand Loren Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 11:49 am cases called.15CF16 & 17CF202. Defendant Dawand Loren Washington in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Defendant Dawand Loren Washington in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. 17CF202-  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. 15CF16-Both counsel have received the Revocation Order and Warrant-no additions or corrections by either counsel. No statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF16-1 year WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 270 days served. 17CF202-SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 3 months WCJ, consecutive to any sentence currently being served. With Huber, No Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. AODA and follow through,   Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with Christopher Abitz and Olivia Woitula.  Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Court directs Attorney Belville to contact SPD regarding appointment and will set all matters together. Court directs a WRIT to be filed for transport.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 2, 2018 at 11:30 am.

Case called @ 1:54 p.m. Defendant Dawand Loren Washington in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by ADA Anderson. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. 15TR222 & 15TR223 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 3 days WCJ - 3 days CFTS - Time served sentence, obtain HSED, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
